The membership has voted! The September Restaurant of the Month is Cotton.

About the Restaurant of the Month:
COTTON, located in Manchester, New Hampshire’s historic Millyard district, is co-owned by Jeffrey Paige, one of New Hampshire’s most celebrated chefs. Jeffrey is co-author of Cooking in the Shaker Spirit, has been featured in numerous publications and on radio and television, and has been the recipient of countless awards and accolades. It might be a surprise to find such a pedigreed chef turning out old-fashioned comfort food, but that is what Jeffrey is doing at Cotton, only with a certain flair and with a helping hand from his wife and business partner, Christine, who runs the front of the house.
A lot of the dishes are familiar comfort foods with a twist or new presentation,” he says. Retro Meatloaf with “All you can eat mashed potatoes” is sauced with a wild mushroom port wine sauce rather than traditional mushroom gravy, and Jeffrey uses Kobe beef for the Bleu Heaven Kobe Beef Burger with applewood smoked bacon, fresh lettuce, hand-cut tomatoes, and homemade pickles. “The meatloaf has never left the menu,” says Jeffrey, “and we make mashed potatoes several times a day in small batches to ensure great potatoes.” As for the burger, Jeffrey believes he was the first to introduce Kobe beef to the southern New Hampshire region when he added it to the menu four years ago.

Jeffrey has put his creative stamp on a few other classics as well, turning them into menu staples in the process. Fried calamari takes the form of Kung Pao Calamari that are crisply fried and nestled atop an Asian vegetable slaw with ginger soy aioli and spicy peanut vinaigrette. French onion soup is transformed into Baked Onion Apple Cider Soup with fresh thyme and Vermont cheddar cheese gratinee, and spinach salad gets a surprising zip from fresh blueberries, shaved red onion, toasted almonds, crumbled Great Hill bleu cheese, and maple balsamic vinaigrette.

Prior to opening Cotton, Jeffrey was the executive chef at Canterbury Shaker Village, in Canterbury, New Hampshire, where a premium was placed on humanely raised and naturally produced meats and seafood, and where much of the produce for the restaurant was grown in the Shaker gardens. Today, Jeffrey adheres to the same standards, using all natural meats, wild caught shellfish, and locally grown organic fruits, vegetables, and herbs whenever possible.

COTTON has an extensive and always expanding list of carefully selected domestic and imported wines, over 40 by the glass, and an award winning seasonal martini list.

Directions:
From the South: Take I-293 North to Exit 5 (Granite Street Bridge). At the end of the exit take a right onto Granite Street. At the first traffic light take a left onto Commercial Street. After approximately 1/2 mile take a left onto Stark Street and an immediate right onto Arms Street. Our parking lot is located on the right just after the restaurant.

From the North: Take I-293 South to Exit 6 (Amoskeag Bridge). Bear right off the exit; go past the Amoskeag Inn, staying in the far right lane. Go over the Amoskeag Bridge and bear right onto Canal Street. At first traffic light take a right onto North Commercial Street. About 1/2 mile take a right onto Stark Street and an immediate right onto Arms Street. Our parking lot is located on the right just after the restaurant.

From the East: Take Route 101 West to I-93 North to Exit 8 (Bridge Street). Take a right off the exit onto Bridge Street. Take Bridge Street for approximately 1+ miles. Take a left onto Elm Street and your second right onto Spring Street. When Spring Street deadends take a left onto Commercial Street. Take your first right onto Stark Street and an immediate right onto Arms Street. Our parking lot is located on the right just after the restaurant.

From the West: Take Route 101 East to I-293 North and follow the directions "From the South".

From the Manchester/ Boston Regional Airport: Exit the airport, taking a right onto Brown Avenue. Stay in the left-hand lane on Brown Avenue and go under the overpass. At the traffic light take a left onto the highway. Stay in the right hand lane towards downtown Manchester I-293 North. Follow the directions "From the South".

From the Radisson Center of NH Hotel: Take a right out of the hotel's parking garage onto Granite Street. At the second traffic light, take a right onto Commercial Street and travel approximately1/2 mile. Take a left onto Stark Street and an immediate right onto Arms Street. Our parking lot is located on the right just after the restaurant.
